**Double Oak Police Department**
================================

It is the mission of the Double Oak Police Department to maintain a safe and peaceful community environment by providing effective and efficient law enforcement services through community partnerships, public education and quality service.

[![Crime Victims Rights](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/bd7e0408-b615-40e1-b8b7-cdae00292e0e/Crime+Victims+Rights.png)](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/crime-victims-rights)

[![Memorial Page](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/595caf35-f27a-4fab-87c3-e4f07fdad315/Memorial+Page.png)](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/memorial-page)

[![Police Contact Form](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/5d0e9279-f71e-4876-b662-313bb7e51e3a/Police+Contact+Form.png)](https://doubleoak.texas.gov/police-contact-form)

About Us
--------

Double Oak is protected 24-hours a day, 365 days a year, by a full-time law enforcement team.

The Double Oak Police Headquarters is located inside the Double Oak Town Hall.

In any emergency, Double Oak residents can dial 9-1-1 to receive a Dispatcher at the Denton County Sheriff's Department.  
  
The Double Oak Police Department was officially activated during the Council Meeting on October 3rd, 1988 at 7:30pm. Double Oak PD began using Denton County Sheriff’s Office Dispatch for receiving calls for service, reducing response times to a matter of minutes. The police department began actively patrolling the streets of Double Oak for its citizen’s protection.

Contact Info
------------

Police Department Facebook page
===============================

The Town of Double Oak Police Department frequently updates their Facebook page! You can scroll through it via the widget here on this page, or if you’d prefer to go straight there you can use [THIS LINK](https://www.facebook.com/doubleoakpolice).

![Group of Double Oak police officers standing together in front of flags and a town seal wall in a formal setting.](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/37db8a60-a397-4470-83a9-56387673683a/DOPD_Group_Photo_Indoor_2025.JPG)

![Police Chief Daniel Miller wearing sunglasses and a dark uniform with badges and a camera around his neck, standing in front of a brick building.](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/682152fec643c844598dff3f/aa618a94-f6f4-485e-b2da-f355fd23c9ce/IMG_2870+-+Copy.jpg)

Meet the Department
-------------------

Daniel Miller  
**Police Chief**  
*Daniel.Miller@doubleoak.texas.gov*

---

Daniel Miller serves as Chief of Police for the Town of Double Oak, bringing nearly two decades of law enforcement experience and a reputation for integrity, leadership, and community focus. His career includes senior roles at the Rowlett Police Department, where he oversaw major operational divisions. With advanced degrees in criminology and organizational leadership, as well as credentials from the FBI National Academy, Chief Miller leads with professionalism and strategic vision. He is committed to building trust, fostering transparency, and guiding a police department that reflects the values of Double Oak.
